briefdescription.para: initialize the slot data-structure: all existing slots will be discarded

detaileddescription.para: Typically, this would be used at the beginning top-level or other outer quqqery

briefdescription.para: discard all existing slots: operates as StartSlots, but should be called when we're done
report the current position of the slots, assuming that they occupy the top of the stack
allocate n empty new slots

detaileddescription.para: Return a handle to the system's default slo t iX_API yhandle_t YAP_NewSlots(int NumberOfSlots);
Allocate NumberOfSlots from the stack and return an handle to the last one The other handle can be obtained by decrementing the handle

briefdescription.para: read from a slot
get the memory address of a slot

detaileddescription.para: Return the address of slot slot: please use with care

briefdescription.para: get the memory address of the term actually stored in a slot
store term in a slot
Succeeds if it recovers the space allocated for $n$ contiguous slots starting at topSlot.

detaileddescription.para: Set the contents of slot slot to t

briefdescription.para: copies the first new n YAAM registers to slots

detaileddescription.para: Store the current first HowMany arguments in new slots

briefdescription.para: copies n slots such that sl is copied to the last abstract ,achine register

detaileddescription.para: Set the first HowMany arguments to the HowMany slots

briefdescription.para: Access to goal arguments.
Copy a term to a goal's arguments.
Term t is unbound.
Term t is bound.
returns whether the atom includes non-ascii code-points
returns the text associated to atom a, as UTF-8
returns the wide text associated to atom a
returns the interned string c
returns the interned wide string c
returns the interned wide string c, even if hidden
returns the size of a string, in characters
Allocate a new variable in the global stack.

memberdef.argsstring: (Term t, Int sz, Int depth, int variant)
memberdef.name: YAP_TermHash

memberdef.argsstring: (choiceptr ptr, int has_cp, int cut_all USES_REGS)
memberdef.name: complete_exit

briefdescription.para: a version of realloc that allocates space in the DB (most often, just realloc)
a version of malloc that allocates space in the DB (most often, just malloc)
a version of free that deallocates space in the DB (most often, just free)
copy a string to a buffer, the buffer must have been malloced

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *file, const char *function, int lineno, int myerrno, Term t, const char *buf,...)
memberdef.name: YAP_Error__

memberdef.argsstring: (int mode, const char *fname, char *full, int *osnop, char *dir)
memberdef.name: YAP_InitConsult

briefdescription.para: given a stream descriptor or stream alias (see open/3 ), return YAP's internal handle
read a Prolog term from an operating system stream $s$
read a Prolog term from a Prolog opened stream $s$

detaileddescription.para: Check YAP_OpenStream() for how to open Prolog streams in C

memberdef.argsstring: (Term t, char *buf, size_t sze, int flags)
memberdef.name: YAP_WriteBuffer

briefdescription.para: write a a term to n user-provided buffer: make sure not tp overflow the buffer even if the text is much larger
Obtain a pointer to the YAP representation of a stream.

detaileddescription.para: Utility routine to Obtain a pointer to the YAP representation of a stream.

briefdescription.para: Output the number of bytes needed to represent a string in UTF-8 Note that the terminating zero is not included.

detaileddescription.para: No error checking is performed (the programmer should have that done)

parameterdescription.para: a list of codes, chars, string or atom

simplesect.para: a positive number with the size, or 0

briefdescription.para: Term handles correspond to SWI-Prolog's term_t datatype: they are a safe representation of terms.

detaileddescription.para: Slots are safe houses in the stack, the garbage collector and the stack shifter know about them and make sure they have correct values In this case, we use a slot to preserve t during the execution of YAP_RunGoal) When the execution of t is over we read the (possibly changed) value of t back from the slot sl and tell YAP that the slot sl is not needed and can be given back to the system
YAP supports storing and manipulating term_t like slots or handles, but in the C the programmer needs to take care as most operations still require unwrapping the term inside
For implementation details and more information, please check term_t_slots in the implementation section
